DOC.brief_summary: In this study we will prospectively analyze the benefit of inhaled furosemide for preterm and term neonates with Transient Tachypnoea.
DOC.brief_title: Trial on Treatment With Inhaled Furosemide of Preterm and Term Neonates With Transient Tachypnoea
DOC.detailed_description: In this study we will prospectively analyze the benefit of inhaled furosemide for preterm and term neonates with transient Tachypnoea. Patients received nebulised Furosemide iv solution 1 mg/kg or nebulised 0,9% saline (4x/d) under blind conditions in random order so long as need a CPAP-treatment but max. 3 days. 20 Patient will be treating. The benefit will be measured as reduction of dyspnea, respiratory rate, oxygen demand and time on CPAP.
DOC.criteria: Neonates with 35+039+0 GA on the first day of life with the clinical diagnosis of Transient Tachypnoea The need for CPAP >6 h to obtain the oxygen saturation >92% Written informed consent of parent/guardian Systemic infection Intubation and mechanical ventilation before Inclusion in the trail Malformation and any other several disease with disturb of respiratory Subjects participating in other clinical trials
